item.title: Beijing Scraps GDP Target, a Bad Sign for World Reliant on China Growth
item.description: China broke with more than a quarter-century of tradition by eschewing an economic growth target for 2020, a stark acknowledgment of the challenges facing the world’s second-largest economy as it grapples with uncertainties around the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: U.S. Plans Nuclear Arms Talks With Russia Aimed at Adding China to Pact
item.description: President Trump’s arms-control negotiator is planning to meet with his Russian counterpart to discuss a new U.S. proposal for an accord to limit the nations’ warheads, U.S. officials said.

item.title: Senators to Propose Sanctioning Chinese OfficialsOver Hong Kong Security Law
item.description: U.S. senators are introducing a bipartisan bill that would sanction Chinese officials and entities who enforce the new national-security laws in Hong Kong, and penalize banks that do business with the entities.

item.title: China Looks to Tighten Its Control Over Hong Kong
item.description: China signaled it will impose new national-security laws on Hong Kong, dealing a blow to the territory’s autonomy as Beijing seeks to stamp out widespread pro-democracy protests that have challenged leader Xi Jinping.

item.title: U.S. Moving to Leave 'Open Skies' Treaty Designed to Reduce Conflict With Russia
item.description: The Trump administration is moving to withdraw from the Open Skies treaty, a nearly three-decade-old accord intended to reduce the risk of war between Russia and the West.

item.title: As Lockdown Eases, Italy Confronts an Epidemic of Poverty
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has precipitated one of the worst economic downturns in generations world-wide. But few major economies are likely to fall as far as Italy’s, or take longer to recover, amid the biggest jump in poverty since the aftermath of World War II.
